item.title: 538以前は野球の統計学者で、最近では公衆衛生学に未熟ながらオンラインのCOVID-19討論会に参加したネイト・シルバーのプロフィール（Dan Rosenzweig-Ziff/Washington Post)
item.description:
Dan Rosenzweig-Ziff / Washington Post:
A profile of Nate Silver, who was a baseball statistician before 538 and most recently entered online COVID-19 debates despite his inexperience in public health  —  Readers only knew him as “poblano.”  —  A baseball statistician by day, the mysterious writer started dipping his toes …

item.title: 情報筋の話タッカー・カールソンがフォックス・ニュースの幹部に「c-word」と言ったが、フォックスの弁護士が法廷で修正し、彼の解雇につながった（Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Tucker Carlson called a senior Fox News executive the c-word, something Fox's lawyers managed to redact in court, which helped lead to his firing  —  Prime-time host called senior executive the c-word in redacted missive; network grew wary of further embarrassment from possible disclosure

item.title: 刑務所での危険ドラッグの使用に関する報道で、当局や受刑者から複数の脅迫を受けた刑務所ジャーナリスト、ジェイソン・ウォーカーのプロフィール（Michelle Pitcher/The Texas Observer）
item.description:
Michelle Pitcher / The Texas Observer:
A profile of Jason Walker, a prison journalist whose reporting on the use of a dangerous drug in prisons has led to multiple threats from officials and inmates  —  In a postscript at the end of the letter, a request.  —  Jason Walker writes his mom's name, says she lives in San Angelo: “Please be my arranger if a funeral is needed.”

item.title: 賞を受賞し、オンラインストーリーテリングの再定義に貢献したBuzzFeed Newsの閉鎖は、ジャーナリズムという行為に敵対する企業文化のさらなる証拠だ（Maria Bustillos/The Nation）。
item.description:
Maria Bustillos / The Nation:
The closing of BuzzFeed News, which won awards and helped redefine online storytelling, is more evidence of a corporate culture hostile to the act of journalism  —  The shuttering of the online publication's news division is yet more evidence of a corporate landscape dangerously hostile to the act of journalism.

item.title: 裁判官は、ヌネス家の農場が非正規労働者を使用していると主張する2018年のライアン・リザの記事に起因するデビン・ヌネスとその親族からの名誉毀損訴訟を棄却した（Dave Byrnes/Courthouse News Service）。
item.description:
Dave Byrnes / Courthouse News Service:
A judge throws out libel suits from Devin Nunes and his relatives stemming from a 2018 Ryan Lizza story alleging the Nunes family farm used undocumented workers  —  The suit stemmed from a political reporter's investigation into claims the former congressman's family used undocumented workers on their Iowa dairy farm.

item.title: 情報筋の話：フォックスは、タッカー・カールソンがネットワークを攻撃した場合、タッカー・カールソンに関する「オッポ・ファイル」の詳細を開示する用意がある、職場での行為に対する苦情などを含む（Rolling Stone）
item.description:
Rolling Stone:
Sources: Fox is prepared to disclose details from an “oppo file” on Tucker Carlson if he attacks the network, including workplace conduct complaints and more  —  Eight sources tell Rolling Stone that the network's top brass has been stockpiling information on the departing primetime host

item.title: 真実を語るジャーナリストを自認するタッカー・カールソンから、陰謀論の推進者、そしてメガ・プロフィットの宣伝マンへの長い道のりを見てみよう（David Corn/Mother Jones）。
item.description:
David Corn / Mother Jones:
A look at Tucker Carlson's long journey from a self-declared truth-telling journalist to a promoter of conspiracy theories and a for-mega-profit propagandist  —  Was his long, strange trip a put-up job?  Tucker Carlson wasn't always Tucker Carlson.  Or maybe he was.

item.title: Alphabet、第1四半期のGoogle広告収入は$54.55B、対前年同期$54.66B、2022年第4四半期の3.6%減に続き2連続減少、上場以来3度目（Miles Kruppa/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Miles Kruppa / Wall Street Journal:
Alphabet reports Q1 Google ad revenue of $54.55B, vs. $54.66B YoY, the second straight decline after a 3.6% drop in Q4 2022, and the third since going public  —  Search giant tries to jump-start growth amid volatile digital ad market and competition in AI  —  Google reported a second straight drop …

item.title: ニュース共有アプリArtifact、記事要約を生成するAIツールを追加、一方で時折エラーが発生するためユーザーは記事全文を読むべきと指摘（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
News sharing app Artifact adds an AI tool to generate article summaries, while noting users should still read the full articles due to occasional errors  —  Artifact, the personalized news aggregator from Instagram's founders is further embracing AI with the launch of a new feature that will now summarize news articles for you.

item.title: スタッフの混乱から軌道に乗せるため、2020年にBon Appétit EICとして採用されたDawn Davisが、Simon & Schusterに戻るため辞任、Jonathan Karp CEOに報告（New York Times)
item.description:
New York Times:
Dawn Davis, hired as Bon Appétit EIC in 2020 to put it back on track after staff turmoil, resigns to return to Simon & Schuster, reporting to CEO Jonathan Karp  —  Ms. Davis, who took charge of the food magazine at a time of turmoil, will head the publishing imprint she founded.

item.title: NPRの調査特派員ティム・マックは、NPRのレイオフの一環で退職した後、ロシアのウクライナ戦争を取材するニュースレター「The Counteroffensive」を立ち上げる（Tim Mak/The Counteroffensive with Tim Mak）。
item.description:
Tim Mak / The Counteroffensive with Tim Mak:
NPR Investigative Correspondent Tim Mak launches The Counteroffensive, a newsletter covering Russia's war in Ukraine, after leaving as part of NPR's layoffs  —  Introducing ‘The Counteroffensive,’ a reporter's open notebook from Ukraine  —  Good morning to readers.  Kyiv remains in Ukrainian hands.

item.title: 2023年第1四半期のYouTubeの広告収入は、前年同期比2.6%減の$66.9Bと3四半期連続で減少し、アナリスト予想の$6.6Bをわずかに上回る（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
YouTube's advertising revenue declined for the third consecutive quarter, by 2.6% YoY to $6.69B in Q1 2023, slightly beating analyst estimates of $6.6B  —  Ad sales at YouTube declined 2.6% year over year in the first quarter of 2023, to $6.69 billion.  Analysts expected it to come in at $6.6 billion, per FactSet.

item.title: タッカー・カールソンとドン・レモンは、その憤怒と暴挙でトランプ時代の産物だった。彼らの追放は、メディアの行き過ぎからの一時的な後退を意味する（Jim Rutenberg/New York Times)
item.description:
Jim Rutenberg / New York Times:
Tucker Carlson and Don Lemon were products of the Trump era with their indignation and outrage; their ousters represent a temporary pullback from media excesses  —  The two hosts took very different approaches, but the decisions by Fox News and CNN to shed the stars mark at least a temporary shift in the excesses of Trump-era coverage.

item.title: Crooked Mediaは、ジャーナリストのCoco KhanとコメディアンのNish Kumarがホストを務める、米国外に拠点を置く初のポッドキャスト「Pod Save the UK」を5月4日に開始する予定だ（Desiree Ibekwe/New York Times）。
item.description:
Desiree Ibekwe / New York Times:
Crooked Media plans to launch Pod Save the UK, its first podcast based outside the US, on May 4, hosted by Coco Khan, a journalist, and Nish Kumar, a comedian  —  The company behind “Pod Save America” is starting a British version of the popular liberal show.  —  Reporting from London

item.title: 裁判資料です：ハリー王子の弁護団は、ウィリアム王子がニューズグループ新聞社と電話ハッキングの訴えを「非常に多額の金額」で密かに解決したと主張している（Lindsay Isaac/CNN)
item.description:
Lindsay Isaac / CNN:
Court documents: Prince Harry's legal team alleges that Prince William secretly settled phone hacking claims with News Group Newspapers for a “very large sum”  —  Buckingham Palace and Rupert Murdoch's News Group Newspapers reached a secret agreement over historical phone hacking claims …
